Description: Limestone stela of Qenamun: a small round-topped stela comprising one scene with two columns of text, all crudely incised. The deified Ahmose-Nefertari stands on the left and is being worshipped by the workman Qenamun who stands on the right. Between them lies an altar piled with offerings. The stela is well preserved and there are no traces of colour.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: The British Museum, 'A guide to the Egyptian galleries (Sculpture)' (London, 1909), 100 (no. 345); B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' I (Part 2) (Oxford: Clarendon Press), ii, 724; M. Gitton, L'Épouse du Dieu Ahmes Néfertary (Paris, 1975), 45-6(13), 69; K.A. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' Vol. 7 (Oxford: Blackwell Press), p324.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1982 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 10. (pl.87)
